name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Thank you, Manitoba! Because of your choice to #ProtectMB, we have hit our second milestone of the 4-3-2-One Great Summer Reopening Path early, giving Manitobans the chance to enjoy our province with less restrictions. Be safe, be smart and together we can beat #COVID19.  https://t.co/qkOb74mqzI

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Congratulations to Arlen Dumas on his re-election as Grand Chief of the Assembly of Manitoba Chiefs! Also to Cindy Woodhouse on her AFN Regional Chief win! We look forward to working with you both!

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: As super-sites across the province continue to receive walk-ins this evening, I would like to thank all Manitobans who stepped up today to continue to #ProtectMB. We have a lot to celebrate today.

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Manitobans are answering the call. We are not out of the woods yet, but with milestones continuing to be met, and more #COVID19Vaccines being administered, Manitobans are now able to enjoy more freedoms with expanded indoor and outdoor activities, safely.  https://t.co/bjH2KtvSBL

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Today Manitobans are stepping up and rolling up their sleeves at our many super-sites across the province. Walk-ins are still available at all locations. Thus far, over 520 first and second doses of #COVID19Vaccine have been administered. Thank you for continuing to #ProtectMB.

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Today is your best shot at the greatest summer ever! All supersites will have walk-in availability for your first or second dose of #Covid19Vaccine (Pfizer 12-17 and Moderna 18+). I encourage all Manitobans to help us #ProtectMB today and be entered in the #VaxToWin lottery!  https://t.co/pMomGGHaEq

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Tomorrow, all supersites across Manitoba will be open for Pfizer (12-17) & Moderna (18+) walk-ins all day. You will also be entered to win $2 million in prizes in the #VaxToWin lottery. This is your shot at the best summer ever! #ProtectMB  https://t.co/wdLewlX22N

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Our deepest condolences to the family and friends of former City Councillor, Harry Lazarenko. His many years of public service on behalf of the residents of Mynarski, and his commitment to building a stronger Winnipeg is commendable. He will be missed.

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Today, I join all Manitobans in congratulating Grand Chief RoseAnne Archibald of the Taykwa Tagamou Nation, on her historic win in becoming the first woman elected as National Chief for the Assembly of First Nations.

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Thanks to the generosity of @DougForDakota and our neighbors down in ND, our Essential Worker Cross-Border Vaccination Initiative has hit a new milestone of 2500+ truck drivers from MB getting vaccinated. The program is now extended through July!  https://t.co/T0Y6IJzuFf

name: Brian Pallister
tweet: Thanks to Manitobans efforts to #ProtectMB, we're first in the country for doses administered per capita. We've met our next reopening milestone sooner than targeted again. name: Brian Pallister
tweet: The discovery of these unmarked graves is deeply saddening, but it is a truth of the terrible legacy of residential schools. We must not shy away from this truth but learn from it as we move forward together in a spirit of reconciliation.
